topComments.author: Alexus Hoechst
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) √ìtimo lugar para os pequenos. Estandes de concess√£o dispon√≠veis. Muitas cadeiras e guarda-s√≥is. Voc√™ pode trazer seu pr√≥prio refrigerador pequeno com lanches e bebidas. Os salva-vidas s√£o incr√≠veis, no entanto, os pais confiam demais neles. Quantidade louca de crian√ßas do acampamento de ver√£o, mas todo mundo estava feliz.  (Original) Great place for the kiddos. Concession stands available.  Lots of chairs and umbrellas. You can bring in your own small soft cooler with snacks and drinks. Lifeguards are awesome, however, parents rely too much on them. Crazy amount of summer camp kids but everyone was happy.

topComments.author: cheree tolley
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Nossa primeira vez l√° e n√≥s amamos este parque aqu√°tico. Muito limpo e a seguran√ßa era uma prioridade. Meio pequeno, mas para algo para fazer durante um dia quente de ver√£o, era perfeito. Excelente se√ß√£o de lanchonete e com arm√°rios para guardar seus pertences pessoais.  (Original) Our first time  there  and we loved this water park.  Very clean and safety was a priority.   Kinda small but for something to do during a hot summer day, it was perfect.   Excellent section at the snack bar and they have lockers for your personal items.

topComments.author: Sharon Alvar
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Calypso Bay coisas para saber antes de ir: O estacionamento √© limitado (e gratuito) e enche rapidamente. Refrigeradores n√£o s√£o permitidos. Eles t√™m arm√°rios que voc√™ pode alugar para seus telefones / dinheiro / chaves etc., o que √© uma √≥tima id√©ia, porque nossa bolsa de toalhas e roupas foi movida duas vezes por estranhos para abrir espa√ßo para suas coisas. Eles n√£o vendem protetor solar ou floaties, ent√£o traga o seu pr√≥prio. Calypso Bay √© um parque aqu√°tico para crian√ßas pequenas. Tem uma √°rea de recrea√ß√£o apropriada para crian√ßas de 1 a 8 anos, um rio lento, pista de obst√°culos (deve ter 42" de altura e poder nadar para us√°-lo) e dois tobo√°guas grandes (deve ter 42" de altura para deslizar). Se voc√™ tem muito pequenos, eles n√£o podem deslizar ou usar a pista de obst√°culos. O rio lento tamb√©m ser√° um desafio para eles, porque os tubos n√£o s√£o pequenos o suficiente para acomodar seu tamanho por conta pr√≥pria, ent√£o eles precisam compartilhar um tubo com um adulto, o que pode causar colapsos com as crian√ßas independentes que querem faz√™-lo em seus pr√≥prios ter.  Visitamos em um s√°bado e o lugar estava lotado. N√≥s t√≠nhamos visitado o parque no ver√£o antes, ent√£o est√°vamos cientes de todas as restri√ß√µes limitadas de entretenimento e tamanho, ent√£o nada disso nos incomodou nesta viagem. O que nos incomodou foi o influxo de crian√ßas mais velhas (12-16 anos) que aparentemente n√£o tinham supervis√£o dos pais e estavam causando estragos no rio lento e na √°rea de mergulho projetada para crian√ßas pequenas.  Tivemos alguns problemas que aconteceram conosco no rio lento. Mencionarei apenas dois. Primeiro, minha fam√≠lia (que inclui uma crian√ßa de 4 e 6 anos) estava flutuando em um lado do rio para permitir que outros passassem quando de repente fomos empurrados. Um grupo de garotos estava tocando uns nos outros com seus tubos - portanto, correndo para os outros e come√ßaram a nos empurrar para a frente. Quando n√£o est√°vamos nos movendo r√°pido o suficiente - um menino gritou ‚ÄúMOVE‚Äù. E eles abriram caminho. O segundo incidente aconteceu na frente de um salva-vidas sentado no rio lento e houve ZERO resposta dela. Minha filha de quatro anos estava em um dos tubos menores (no qual ela mal cabe, mas queria experimentar, felizmente ela tinha flutuadores), eu estava ao lado dela quando um grupo de crian√ßas come√ßou a correr no rio com seus tubos, eles me separaram da minha filha de quatro anos, eles inadvertidamente a tiraram do tubo e, em seguida, abriram caminho √† frente de v√°rias fam√≠lias. Parece que as crian√ßas mais velhas parecem pensar que o rio lento √© uma estrada e torna a experi√™ncia mais frustrante do que relaxante. Os salva-vidas n√£o os param ou pedem que respeitem os outros no rio.  A √°rea de respingo √© outra bagun√ßa. Minhas meninas foram gritadas v√°rias vezes por adolescentes para ‚Äúse mexer‚Äù ou ‚Äúsair do caminho‚Äù quando a √°rea de respingo n√£o √© projetada para crian√ßas mais velhas. A certa altura, dois salva-vidas estavam tirando sarro de uma m√£e em um mai√¥ mal ajustado e minha filha quase chutou outra crian√ßa no rosto descendo um dos escorregadores porque eles n√£o estavam dizendo √†s crian√ßas para sair do tapete azul no fundo do o deslize. Os salva-vidas literalmente sentaram-se em sil√™ncio e observaram o caos e n√£o fizeram nada para impedir ou par√°-lo. Foi muito desconfort√°vel.  J√° estivemos em Calypso Bay uma vez antes e adoramos. Os nadadores-salvadores (no ano passado) estiveram ativamente presentes e trabalhando para garantir a seguran√ßa dos visitantes. Este ano foi completamente diferente. Eu sei que o objetivo desses lugares sazonais √© ganhar dinheiro, mas deve haver uma regra de n√£o menores desacompanhados. N√£o h√° nada para eles fazerem, quando s√£o for√ßados a ficar l√° o dia todo - eles ficam entediados e barulhentos. No final - as fam√≠lias s√£o o que traz o dinheiro e se menores desacompanhados est√£o arruinando sua experi√™ncia, essas fam√≠lias n√£o voltar√£o.  (Original) Calypso Bay things to know before you go: Parking is limited (and free) and fills up quickly. Coolers are not permitted. They have lockers that you can rent for your phones/money/keys etc which is a great idea because our bag of towels and clothes were moved twice by strangers to make room for their stuff. They do not sell sunblock or floaties so bring your own. Calypso Bay is a water park for LITTLE kids. It has a play area which is appropriate for kids that are 1-8 years old, a lazy river, obstacle course (must be 42‚Äù tall and able to swim to use it) and two large water slides (must be 42‚Äù tall to slide). If you have really little ones, they cannot slide or use the obstacle course. The lazy river will be also be challenging for them because the tubes aren‚Äôt small enough to accommodate their size on their own so they have to share a tube with an adult which can cause meltdowns with the independent kids that want to do it on their own.  We visited on a Saturday and the place was packed. We had visited the park the summer before so we were aware of all the limited entertainment and size restrictions so none of that bothered us on this trip. What did bother us was the influx of older kids (12-16 years old) that seemly had zero parental supervision and were causing havoc on the lazy river and in the splash area designed for little kids.  We had a few issues that happened to us on the lazy river. I‚Äôll mention only two.  First, my family (which includes a 4 & 6 year old) were floating on one side of the river to allow others to pass when suddenly we were pushed. A group of boys were jamming into each other with their tubes - therefore running into others and started pushing us forward. When we weren‚Äôt moving fast enough - one boy yelled ‚ÄúMOVE.‚Äù And they pushed their way through. The second incident happened in front of a seated lifeguard on the lazy river and there was ZERO response from her. My four year old was on one of the smaller tubes (which she barely fits on but wanted to try, thankfully she had floaties on), I was next to her when a group of kids started running in the river with their tubes on, they separated me from my four years old, they inadvertently flipped her off her tube and then rammed their way ahead of multiple families. It appears that the older kids seem to think that the lazy river is a speedway and makes the experience more frustrating than relaxing. Lifeguards do not stop them or ask them to respect the others on the river.  The splash area is another mess. My girls were yelled at multiple times by teens to ‚Äúmove‚Äù or ‚Äúget out of the way‚Äù when the splash area isn‚Äôt designed for older kids. Two lifeguards at one point were making fun of a mom in an ill fitting swimsuit and my daughter almost kicked another child in the face coming down one of the slides because they weren‚Äôt telling the kids to move off the blue mat at the bottom of the slide. Lifeguards literally sat quietly and watched the chaos and did nothing to prevent or stop it. It was very uncomfortable.  We had been to Calypso Bay once before and absolutely loved it. The lifeguards (last year) were actively present and working to ensure the safety of the visitors. This year was completely different. I know the goal of these seasonal places is to make money but there should be a rule of no unaccompanied minors. There is nothing for them to do so, when they‚Äôre forced to be there all day - they get bored and get rowdy. In the end - families are what brings in the money and if unaccompanied minors are ruining their experience, those families won‚Äôt be coming back.

topComments.comment: We love it, my son love it had his first long water slide here ,also they have a big parking lot ,the water park is very clean they have long water slides wich ends with a 3 feet deep pool wich is perfect for younger kids prices for the water park also not expensive
